item.title: Report E-2025030394
item.description:
Report E-2025030394

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-27T15:24:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-24
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 24, 2025, six (6) 1-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and cleaning agents to clean the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report I-2025030056
item.description:
Report I-2025030056

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-27T15:24:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-17
  • City: Cleveland
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HIGHWAY TRANSPORT CHEMICAL, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver observed material leaking down the side of his tanker. Driver inspected the top of the tanker and observed there was no dome lid gasket. Driver reported to his Safety Department, and they called Environmental Management, Inc. (EMI) to initiate a response. EMI contacted a local subcontractor, Haz Mat Special Services (HMSS), to respond to the release. HMSS arrived and placed absorbents underneath the tanker. HMSS cleaned around the dome lid and crash box and then installed a new gasket and secured the dome lid. The side of the tanker was then wiped down with absorbent pads. A power Washer was used to wash the side of the tanker and all the reinstate was captured. The tanker was then moved forward and the absorbents swept up and, placed into a 55-gallon open-top drum. The area on the concrete parking lot, which was approximately 10 feet in diameter, was then power washed and the water collected. All waste was placed into the one (1) drum and removed from the site for disposal at a later date.

item.title: Report E-2025030376
item.description:
Report E-2025030376

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-24
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 24, 2025, four (4) 5-gallon pails of paint were punctured and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained E3 Environmental to remediate the site. The crew collected the damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. Absorbents and hand tools were used to remediate the trailer, and all waste was containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.
